answers.answer: I have no experience with this, but do what you feel comfortable with.  Best wishes.  :)
Do what you're comfortable with. If that's c section just be confident! You don't have to explain yourself and your decisions to anyone :)

If having a scheduled c section makes u less stressed out go for it whatever makes u feel better and like they say what makes u feel confident go for. Pregnancy it's hard as it is and then with GD and then with the stress that u live an hour and way from hospital. U should do what makes u feel relaxed.  Just do some research on my opinion and on c section then u decide. What ever u decide wish u the best. How far along are u?

I'm so happy that I'm having a c sec with baby #2 I wanted to do a v back them I got the worst back labor ever and was like no cut me and get it over with my older 2 I was in labor for hrs then got a c sec this time I just want to get it done no labor needed

question: Since I had a successful vbac with my second I was giving the choice of going for another vbac or a csection with this one. And even though I really enjoyed the experience of natural birth im leaning towards csection. I have just not had as easy of a pregnacy with this one. Having Gestation Diabetes and worry cause I live about a hour away from the hospital that I'll end up not making it and having a vbac on my own. With my vbac before she was out in 45minutes. I just feel way more stressed and worried about a vbac with this one. Has any one else decided on a csection after a vbac? I
title: choosing a C-section after having a VBAC
